706252f-b.title: Brooklyn: Pierrepont Place - Pierrepont Street
706252f-b.text:
Pierrepont Place, east side, from Pierrepont Street; in the
background, to Montague Street in the foreground. The bridge is a
passenger crossing Over Montague Street, which street starts down
at the East River.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same; showing the west side of Pierrepont Place.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, as seen from Montague Street which here slopes downwards
to the East River. The upper level is used solely by pedestrians.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
706252f-b.folder: Pierrepont Place & Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn, NY

Columbia Heights, no.222, at cor. ofPierrepont St. \& Pierrepont Pl.
Federal Art Project, 'Changing New (ork,' )hotographs by

Neg. eio Code: IA3

703721f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Pierrepont Street
703721f-a.text:
196-214 Columbia Heights, west side, north of Pierrepont Street, show.
ing No. 204 (5-story building) to the left of which is the former hone of
DDeacon White.(No. 210).
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPPODUCED.
703721f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn, NY

703722f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Pierrepont Street
703722f-a.text:
201 Columbia Heights, at the N.E. corner of Pierrepont Street, showing
the home of 8eth Low who was born at No. 165 (now 189) Washington Street,
on eanuary 18, 1850.  He was elected Mayor of Brooklyn in 1881. This
house owned by James Humphreys, a republican, who was a member of Congress
during the Civil War, was sold to Mr.Seth Low who modernized it. The house
was rased in May 1924.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703722f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn, NY

703723f-b.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Pierrepont Street
703723f-b.text:
(1)
220-222 Columbia Heights, at the N.W. corner of Columbia Heights
and Pierrepont Street. The house at the left was that of Peter C. Cor-
nell and later that of David H. Leggett. The house at the right (No. 220)
belonged to John Bullet, and at one time was occupied by Henry K. Shelton.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPPODUCED.
(2) The same, showing a further view north.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703723f-b.folder: Columbia Heights & Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn, NY

706249f-a.title: Brooklyn: Pierrepont Place - Pierrepont Street
706249f-a.text:
1-3 Pierrepont Place, west side, south from Pierrepont to Montague
Streets. The pedestrians bridge in the background, crosses Montague Street,
which at this point, slopes down to the East River. Also seen is 2-10
Montague Terrace, west side, south from Montague to Remsen Streets.
( Montague Terrace, is really a continuation of Pierrepont Placel.
June 1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
706249f-a.folder: Pierrepont Place & Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn, NY
